title: Masterpiece of the Month: Japanese Actor Print by Toshusai Sharaku
description: During January 1940, a woodblock print of Kabuki actor, “Ichikawa Omezo, as Ippei, a Man Servant,” by Japanese ukiyo-e artist Toshusai Sharaku was featured as Masterpiece of the Month. Much of the details of Sharaku’s life remains unknown, along with his true identity. There have been many theories about who Toshusai Sharaku; perhaps he was a Noh actor or maybe Sharaku was one of the many pseudonyms used by Hokusai. However, there hasn’t been enough evidence clearly supporting any of these theories. What is certain is that Sharaku’s expressive and bold portraits of Kabuki actors have influenced many artists and have appealed to many art enthusiasts.

input: Masterpiece of the Month: Japanese Actor Print by Toshusai Sharaku
